thread.title: SB MVP should have been White, but had to be Brady
thread.title_full: SB MVP should have been White, but had to be Brady

author: USA TODAY
title: SB MVP should have been White, but had to be Brady
text:
SB MVP should have been White, but had to be Brady Both were pretty valuable. Post to Facebook SB MVP should have been White, but had to be Brady Both were pretty valuable. Check  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/super-bowl-51-new-england-patriots-atlanta-falcons-mvp-tom-brady-james-white/   SB MVP should have been White, but had to be Brady Charles Curtis , USA TODAY 12:00   
HOUSTON, TX - FEBRUARY 05: James White #28 of the New England Patriots holds the Vince Lombardi Trophy to celebrate after defeating the Atlanta Falcons 34-28 in overtime during Super Bowl 51 at NRG Stadium on February 5, 2017 in Houston, Texas. (Photo by Tom Pennington/Getty Images) ORG XMIT: 694911629 ORIG FILE ID: 633956682 (Photo: Getty Images) 
Once again, Bill Belichick's New England Patriots found a way to win by elevating a role player to star status and using him to exploit their opponent. 
And that role player, James White, should have hoisted the MVP trophy. 
Now, look: We all know the Pats wouldn't have done a thing in their insane comeback in Super Bowl 51 without Tom Brady and his 466 passing yards. What he helped engineer on Sunday was nothing short of astounding, and with heroics from just about everyone up and down the roster, it's hard to single out anyone but the superstar for the most valuable player. 
But White caught an astounding 14 receptions, smashing a Super Bowl record. And he matched Terrell Davis's Super Bowl XXXII with three touchdowns (which earned Davis the MVP), the last of which was a Herculean effort to find the end zone for the game-winning score. James White: 14 receptions (Super Bowl record)first player with 3 TD in a Super Bowl since Terrell Davis in Super Bowl XXXII pic.twitter.com/d9gPlPih7c â€” ESPN Stats & Info (@ESPNStatsInfo) February 6, 2017 IT'S OVER! IT'S OVER!
